member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.GetUnityJoystickIdFromAnyButtonPress
member.summary: Returns the 0 based id of the Unity joystick whose button was pressed. -1 if no button was pressed on any joystick. Use this to identify joysticks when using Unity's input system. This has no effect if Unity Input is not handling input on the current platform.
member.returns: 0-based index of the Unity joystick whose button was pressed

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.GetUnityJoystickIdFromAnyButtonOrAxisPress(System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the 0 based id of the Unity joystick whose button or axis was pressed. -1 if no button or axis was pressed on any joystick. Use this to identify joysticks when using Unity's input system. This has no effect if Unity Input is not handling input on the current platform.
member.returns: 0-based index of the Unity joystick whose button or axis was pressed
member.param: Any axis value below this threshold will be ignored.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.SetUnityJoystickId(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a Unity joystick as the input source of a Joystick. Use this to remap a joystick to its source when reconnected on platforms that use Unity Input. This has no effect if Unity Input is not handling input on the current platform.
member.param: The id of the Joystick whose input source you are remapping.
The 0 based index of the Unity joystick which will become the Joystick's new input source.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.SetUnityJoystickIdFromAnyButtonPress(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets a Unity joystick as the input source of a Joystick. The first Unity joystick that returns a button press will be assigned to the Joystick. While no buttons are pressed, this will return False. When a button press is detected, it will return True and assign the joystick id.
member.returns: True if a joystick button was pressed and a joystick id was assigned.

member.name: M:Rewired.ReInput.ControllerHelper.SetUnityJoystickIdFromAnyButtonOrAxisPress(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a Unity joystick as the input source of a Joystick. The first Unity joystick that returns a button or axis press will be assigned to the Joystick. While no buttons or axes are pressed, this will return False. When a press is detected, it will return True and assign the joystick id.
member.returns: True if a joystick button was pressed and a joystick id was assigned.
member.param: Any axis value below this threshold will be ignored.

member.name: M:Rewired.Data.UserData.FindJoystickMap_Game(Rewired.InputSource,System.Int32,System.Guid,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the user-defined maps for a matching map based on category, layout, controller Guid, and template Guid. First it will search for an exact controller guid + category + layout match. If no controller guid's match, it search for a template map. Failing that, it will search for a generic map. If no map is found, a blank map will be loaded.

member.name: M:Rewired.Data.UserData.FindKeyboardMap_Game(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the user-defined maps for a matching map based on category, layout, controller Guid, and template Guid. First it will search for an exact controller guid + category + layout match. If no controller guid's match, it search for a template map. Failing that, it will search for a generic map. If no map is found, a blank map will be loaded.

member.summary: Searches the user-defined maps for a matching map based on category, layout, controller Guid, and template Guid. First it will search for an exact controller guid + category + layout match. If no controller guid's match, it search for a template map. Failing that, it will search for a generic map. If no map is found, a blank map will be loaded.

member.name: M:Rewired.Data.UserData.FindCustomControllerMap_Game(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches the user-defined maps for a matching map based on category, layout, controller Guid, and template Guid. First it will search for an exact controller guid + category + layout match. If no controller guid's match, it search for a template map. Failing that, it will search for a generic map. If no map is found, a blank map will be loaded.

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.Pool`1
member.summary: An expandable array pool. Searches for first empty element before expanding. NOTE: DOES NOT WORK FOR INT or FLOAT since Default(T) = 0!!!

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.Workpool`1
member.summary: A fixed-length array that is more efficient because it only works on entries that have been filled.

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.Workpool_int
member.summary: A fixed-length array that is more efficient because it only works on entries that have been filled. Type: int

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.Workpool_float
member.summary: A fixed-length array that is more efficient because it only works on entries that have been filled. Type: float

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.Workpool_bool
member.summary: A fixed-length array that is more efficient because it only works on entries that have been filled. Type: bool

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.Workpool_Vector3
member.summary: A fixed-length array that is more efficient because it only works on entries that have been filled. Type: Vector3

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.Workpool_object
member.summary: A fixed-length array that is more efficient because it only works on entries that have been filled. Type: object

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.Workpool_DataContainer`1
member.summary: A Workpool which uses objects to hold data. Creates an object for every entry. These objects remain even when Clear is called, but the contents are cleared. Data is added by padding another instance of T object from which the contents are copied to the public object. The passed object itself is not added, but objects contained in the passer object are stored by reference (not cloned). You cannot add objects to the list directly, only data witin the object. Your T must implement the Workpool_DataContainer<T>.IEntry interface.

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.WorkQueue`1
member.summary: A fixed-length array that is more efficient because it only works on entries that have been filled. It behaves like a queue where older items scroll off the list as new ones are added. However, instead of pushing every item down in the list when an entry is added, we advance the current position each time and wrap back to 0 when the end is reached.

member.name: T:Rewired.Utils.Classes.Data.Queue`1
member.summary: A fixed-length list. New items are added at the end. When Process is called, the first item is taken out of the queue and the list collapsed.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.MathTools.MaxMagnitude(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Compares absolute values. If magnitude of a >= b, a will be returned.

member.summary: Compares absolute values. If magnitude of a >= b, a will be returned.

member.name: M:Rewired.Utils.UnityTools.DetermineWebplayerPlatformType(Rewired.Platforms.Platform,Rewired.Platforms.EditorPlatform)
member.summary: Only works if called from within #if UNITY_WEBPLAYER so we KNOW this a webplayer. Always call before setting platform to Webplayer. Platform should have info about the real system platform based on #ifs
